chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The insects in my house are annoying because they like to eat away at my food if I leave any out.
humanum_full_description_en:
Xiaozhuan from " worm " from "飤", "飤" also sounds. "飤" is the same as "食", and " 𧐂 " is also written as " eclipse ". " Eclipse " refers to astronomical phenomena, solar eclipse and lunar eclipse, and is also written as solar eclipse and lunar eclipse. The ancients thought that solar eclipses and lunar eclipses were eaten by the sun and the moon, but they were originally represented by " eclipses ", such as "Spring and Autumn. "The Seventeenth Year of Huan Gong": "Winter October New Moon, the sun has eclipse." Later, for distinction, the word " eclipse " was added next to " worm ". Such as "Huainanzi. "Said Lin": "The moon shines on the world, and eclipses Zhanzhu." "Zhanzhu" means toad. The ancients thought that the moon was eaten by toads in the sky. Another example is "Han Shu. "Wen Di Ji": "Ding Maohui in November, the sun will eclipse."

The extension of " eclipse " means being eaten by insects or eroded. "Ancient and Modern Rhyme Meeting Essentials. "Position Ministry": "Everything that invades beetles is eroded." For example, Du Fu in the Tang Dynasty "Stalagmite Walk": "In ancient times, it was said that it was sea eyes, moss eroded the waves." Mei Yaochen of the Northern Song Dynasty "Liu Yuanfu Ancient Money Persuade Wine": "Jing The copper doesn't erode, and the flesh is nice and graceful."
humanum_short_description_en: Xiaozhuan from " worm " from "飤", "飤" also sounds. "飤" is the same as "食", and " 𧐂 " is also written as " eclipse ". " Eclipse " refers to astronomical phenomena, solar eclipse and lunar eclipse, and is also written as solar eclipse and lunar eclipse.
humanum_full_description:
小篆從「虫」從「飤」，「飤」亦聲。「飤」同「食」，「𧐂」又寫作「蝕」。「蝕」表示天文現象日蝕和月蝕，又寫作日食和月食。古人以為日蝕和月蝕是太陽和月亮被吃掉，原來是用「食」表示，例如《春秋．桓公十七年》：「冬十月朔，日有食之。」後來為了區別，又加上「虫」旁分化出「蝕」字。如《淮南子．說林》：「月照天下，蝕於詹諸。」「詹諸」即蟾蜍，古人以為月蝕是月亮是被天上的蟾蜍所食。又如《漢書．文帝紀》：「十一月丁卯晦，日有蝕之。」

　　「蝕」後引申表示被蟲蛀或侵蝕。《古今韻會舉要．職部》：「凡物侵蠹皆曰蝕。」如唐代杜甫〈石筍行〉：「古來相傳是海眼，苔蘚蝕盡波濤痕。」北宋梅堯臣〈劉原甫古錢勸酒〉：「精銅不蠹蝕，肉好鉤婉全。」
humanum_short_description: 小篆從「虫」從「飤」，「飤」亦聲。「飤」同「食」，「𧐂」又寫作「蝕」。「蝕」表示天文現象日蝕和月蝕，又寫作日食和月食。

Kanshudo mnemonic:when an insect (虫) eats (𩙿) it eats into
Chinese: If left unguarded insects will eat away at any food.  
Meaning: eat away
Hanzi: 蚀
Story: The insects in my house are annoying because they like to eat away at my food if I leave any out.
Kind: traditional

小篆從「 虫 」從「 飤 」，「 飤 」亦聲。「 飤 」同「 食 」，「 𧐂 」又寫作「 蝕 」。「 蝕 」表示天文現象日蝕和月蝕，又寫作日食和月食。古人以為日蝕和月蝕是太陽和月亮被吃掉，原來是用「 食 」表示，例如《春秋．桓公十七年》：「冬十月朔，日有食之。」後來為了區別，又加上「 虫 」旁分化出「 蝕 」字。如《淮南子．說林》：「月照天下，蝕於詹諸。」「詹諸」即蟾蜍，古人以為月蝕是月亮是被天上的蟾蜍所食。又如《漢書．文帝紀》：「十一月丁卯晦，日有蝕之。」 「 蝕 」後引申表示被蟲蛀或侵蝕。《古今韻會舉要．職部》：「凡物侵蠹皆曰蝕。」如唐代杜甫〈石筍行〉：「古來相傳是海眼，苔蘚蝕盡波濤痕。」北宋梅堯臣〈劉原甫古錢勸酒〉：「精銅不蠹蝕，肉好鉤婉全。」
Xiaozhuan from " worm" from " 飤", " 飤" also sounds. " 飤" is the same as " 食", and " 𧐂" is also written as " eclipse". " Eclipse" refers to astronomical phenomena, solar eclipse and lunar eclipse, and is also written as solar eclipse and lunar eclipse. The ancients thought that solar eclipses and lunar eclipses were eaten by the sun and the moon, but they were originally represented by " eclipses", such as "Spring and Autumn. "The Seventeenth Year of Huan Gong": "Winter October New Moon, the sun has eclipse." Later, for distinction, the word " eclipse" was added next to " worm". Such as "Huainanzi. "Said Lin": "The moon shines on the world, and eclipses Zhanzhu." "Zhanzhu" means toad. The ancients thought that the moon was eaten by toads in the sky. Another example is "Han Shu. "Wen Di Ji": "Ding Maohui in November, the sun will eclipse." The extension of " eclipse" means being eaten by insects or eroded. "Ancient and Modern Rhyme Meeting Essentials. "Position Ministry": "Everything that invades beetles is eroded." For example, Du Fu in the Tang Dynasty "Stalagmite Walk": "In ancient times, it was said that it was sea eyes, moss eroded the waves." Mei Yaochen of the Northern Song Dynasty "Liu Yuanfu Ancient Money Persuade Wine": "Jing The copper doesn't erode, and the flesh is nice and graceful."

蝕字的基本解释

蝕
shí
见“蚀”。

蝕字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shí］
［《廣韻》乘力切，入職，船。］
“蚀1”的繁体字。
(1)日月食。
(2)干扰；冲犯。
(3)侵蚀。
(4)毁坏。
(5)损失；亏耗。
[②]［lì］
［《集韻》六直切，入職，來。］
“蚀2”的繁体字。
谷名。

蝕字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蝕； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1089第10
【唐韻】乗力切【集韻】【韻會】實職切，?音食。【廣韻】敗創也。【玉篇】日月蝕也。【釋名】日月虧曰蝕，稍小侵虧如蟲食草木之葉。【漢書·韋昭註】虧敗曰蝕。【晉書·天文志】十煇，五曰闇，謂日月蝕。或曰脫光也。《春秋》本作食。　又【韻會】凡物侵蠹皆曰蝕。　又【集韻】六直切，音力。谷名，在杜南。【前漢·高帝紀】從杜南入蝕中。【李奇註】蝕音力。【如淳曰】蝕，入漢中道川谷名。　又盧東切，音籠。與豅同。詳豅字註。　或作?。
